required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Radiographic Evaluation of Advanced Platelet Rich Fibrin in the Preservation of Alveolar Ridge Following Atraumatic Tooth Extraction
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiographic Evaluation of Advanced Platelet Rich Fibrin in the Preservation of Alveolar Ridge Following Atraumatic Tooth Extraction: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: compare the effect of application of A-PRF in socket preservation after atraumatic tooth extraction and natural healing regarding to bone remodeling . Null hypotheis, after atraumatic extraction, socket with advanced PRF has no difference with socket with blood clot in primary outcome

primary_outcome.measure: mesial and distal height of extraction site

secondary_outcome.description: will be evaluated by endo file with rubber stopper and digital caliper

intervention.description: Socket preservation with APRF , A-PRF membranes were implanted into the extraction socket following tooth extraction. One entire A-PRF membrane would be placed at the base of the extraction socket and another A-PRF membrane will cover the extraction site then suturing will be done .Venous blood will be collected via venipuncture of the forearm with a butterfly needle into at least 10 mL sterile glass vacuum tube. The blood sample will be immediately centrifuged at 1,300 rpm (200 x g) for 8 minutes
after atraumatic extraction , the socket will be left for natural healing after suturing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The inclusion criteria are as follow :
- patients with an unremarkable medical history
- subjects with at least one site bordered by minimum of one tooth.
- Nonsmoker
- Teeth with root fracture, teeth with failed endodontic therapy or advanced caries
- Intact extraction socket with no dehiscence or fenestration.
- The buccolingual thickness of the buccal plate of bone in surgical area is 1 mm or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with systemic diseases.
- Patients with presence or history of osteonecrosis of the jaws, with use of bisphosphonates, exposure to head and neck radiation, chemotherapy.
- patients with large distinct pre-apical pathology
